data.title: wife Liza Minnelli' just days after his death
data.meta_description: The actress refused to speak about the former I’m a Celebrity star adding she cut all contact from him while he was alive following their bitter divorce
data.text:
Liza Minnelli branded her ex-husband David Gest an “a hole” just days after he died in a London hotel, it has been claimed.

The actress refused to speak about the former I’m a Celebrity star adding she cut all contact from him while he was alive following their bitter divorce.

Speaking to her friend, New York Post gossip columnist Cindy Adams, who was a bridesmaid at the couple’s wedding in 2002, the Cabaret star when asked said: “He was an a hole”.

Her comment came after it was claimed Gest, who died last Tuesday aged 62, suffered amnesia before his death blaming it on an alleged blow to the head by Minnelli with one of her stilettos.

The music producer’s friend, Mark Lester, said he suffered memory loss after the alleged incident which the actress denies.

Oliver star Lester said: "He wanted to remember the happy times with Liza. Although their marriage was volatile and ended badly, he loved her.

“But he said his memory had gone because of clashes in their relationship and being struck on the head by Liza’s stiletto."

Read more:David Gest ‘suffered memory loss before his death which he blamed on Liza Minnelli

A spokesman for Minnelli, 70, refuted the claims saying: "There is no truth to the report whatsoever."

Their four year marriage was plagued with volatility.

Gest openly accused Minnelli of attacking him on a number of occasions in the past, including an alleged incident in 2003 while they were staying at London's Connaught Hotel.

Legal papers claimed she "began beating [Gest] about the head and face with her fists without relenting. Alcohol gave her remarkable force and strength."

The actress always denied the claims.

During Adams withering piece she attacked Gest several times at point saying he “wore more mascara than I did”.
